thread.title: Fears grow over missing daughter of London ExCel boss
thread.title_full: Fears grow over missing daughter of London ExCel boss

author: Martin Evans
title: Fears grow over missing daughter of London ExCel boss
text:
Fears grow over missing daughter of London ExCel boss Alice Brindley is missing and thought to be in London Credit: SWNS Martin Evans , Crime Correspondent 20 March 2017 • 2:02pm 
T he parents of a 13-year-old girl have begged her to come home after she went missing following a day out with friends. 
Alice Brindley from Ixworth Thorpe in Suffolk had been in Cambridge for the day and was supposed to catch the train home on Sunday evening but did not arrive. 
It is believed she boarded a train to London instead and had frantic parents are becoming increasingly concerned for her welfare. 
Her father, Paul Brindley, 52, who is an executive director of the London ExCel venue, took to Twitter in the hope of tracing the schoolgirl. 
He wrote: "Can everyone please retweet my lovely little girl has gone missing any help to find her would be greatly appreciated to bring her home." 
He also posted a selfie took of herself just hours before she was last seen. Can everyone please retweet my lovely little girl has gone missing any help to find her would be greatly appreciated to bring her home. https://t.co/vt0whargNW — Paul Brindley (@paulb5261) March 20, 2017 
M r Brindley said his daughter, who attends the £3,700 a year independent Finborough School in Stowmarket, had been with two friends in Cambridge on Sunday afternoon. 
Each friend had been under the impression that Alice was travelling home with the other, but instead it is thought she boarded a train to King's Cross in London. Alice's parents have pleaded for her to get in touch and return home Credit: Archant Suffolk 
H er mother Sarah, 48, added: "She's just a teenager who can get grumpy but doesn't go off to London without telling anyone. 
"We're just desperate for her to come home. We want her to know we love her very much and there's nothing we want more than to know she's safe." 
It is thought she may have been intending to travel to Walthamstow in east London. 
A lice is described as white with shaved red hair. 
At the time she was last seen, Alice was wearing black skinny jeans and a black hoodie with a grey sheepskin top underneath the hoodie. 
She was wearing a pair of black trainers and was also carrying a black leather rucksack bag with gold coloured zips. 
Police officers say they are concerned for the teenager's welfare and are asking anyone who may have seen Alice or has any information about her whereabouts to contact Suffolk Constabulary on 101. Share this article
